hero.name: ARUNA SENTHAMARAIKANNAN
hero.subtitle: MS in Software Engineering Systems at Northeastern University
hero.quote: In the code of life, ambition is the syntax, inspiration is the logic, and innovation is the output.

about.name: Aruna Senthamaraikannan
about.description: I’m a passionate software engineer who enjoys building things that are helpful, smart, and easy to use. I’m currently pursuing my Master’s in Software Engineering Systems at Northeastern University. I like working on web apps, solving real-world problems with technology, and turning ideas into real solutions. In my free time, I enjoy listening to music especially BTS songs and learning new things through storytelling and design. This portfolio is a small part of my journey so far.

projects.title: MBTA+ Transit App
projects.description: A smart transit app for MBTA users featuring real-time tracking, AI route suggestions, and a virtual MBTA card for digital payments. Designed to reduce delays and make commuting easier for locals and tourists.

projects.title: Movie Bookmark Platform
projects.description: Built a web app where users can search and save their favorite movies. It has filters for genre, title, and year, with a responsive design for a smooth experience.

projects.title: Recipe Management Application
projects.description: A desktop app built with JavaFX for organizing and planning recipes. Features include recipe storage using SQLite, Spoonacular API integration, and personalized dashboards for users.

projects.title: Placement Prediction
projects.description: A Python-based machine learning project for predicting campus placements using classification models and EDA.

projects.title: Interactive Data Visualization
projects.description: Interactive data visualization platform using JavaScript to explore datasets in an intuitive and dynamic way.

projects.title: Tourist Management Using Ant-Colony Optimization Algorithm
projects.description: Android app for Tamil Nadu tourism built with Kotlin and Node.js. Features a personalized recommendation system using Ant Colony Optimization to enhance travel planning.

projects.title: Adaptive Difficulty Shooter Game
projects.description: A 2D shooter game built using Java and JavaFX that dynamically adjusts gameplay difficulty in real time based on player performance metrics such as accuracy, score progression, and enemy bypass count.

projects.title: PaperRank AI – Research Overload Solver
projects.description: An AI-powered research tool that aggregates academic papers from multiple databases, ranks them by relevance, quality, and innovation, and presents concise, scored results to dramatically reduce literature review time.

experience.description: Built an automated evaluation platform (Airtable API + JS, custom scoring) that standardized cross-program workflows, cut manual review time by 70%, and resolved 10+ critical UI/UX defects via structured testing.

Led a 3-developer research team to build and deploy Python FastAPI REST services on AWS (OpenAPI/Swagger) processing 500+ medical records/day and integrating LLM-based diagnostic models (85% accuracy on edge-case triage). Designed automated evaluation pipelines in Python + MongoDB with CI/CD to benchmark models against doctor-confirmed outcomes, monitor performance, and run ICD-11 classification on 24-hour refresh cycles. Partnered with clinicians to define research goals and validation protocols, translating clinical requirements into iterative software specs with version control.

Built a responsive React + TypeScript web app with a reusable UI component library and interactive data visualizations. Ran user research and A/B tests to optimize UX. Designed a chatbot interface in Figma and implemented scalable, atomic-design components with state management and REST API integrations to streamline academic application workflows, earning 85% 'good' or 'excellent' user ratings.

Built high-performance transportation apps with Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, and Angular. Integrated Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time updates, cutting API latency by 35% in production. Designed Spring Boot microservices using hexagonal architecture and a Backend-for-Frontend (BFF) pattern; implemented gRPC/Protocol Buffers for geospatial map rendering and navigation, and used Apache Kafka for event-driven messaging across legacy and modern services. Drove quality with JUnit and Postman tests to ~75% coverage and shipped via Jenkins CI/CD, Terraform IaC, and Docker.
